--- In junit@y..., Marko Schulz <4mschulz@i...> wrote:
> On Mon, Apr 22, 2002 at 10:30:08PM -0700, Meraj Khan wrote:
> > 
> > I was wondering if I could use junit for testing
> > programs requiring input from the terminal.
> > Please let me know.
> 
> Sure, your tests can read input from the terminal.
> 
> But the general advice is: Don't do it. Make your tests fully
> automatic without any user interference or you will soon grow tired 
of
> running them.

You can make unit tests of console programs fully automatic by 
redirecting System.out and System.in (and, if necessary, System.err)
to other streams that are set up and used by the unit test.  
One consequence of doing this is that you may need to run the 
program in a separate thread from the test thread ... which is 
irritating, but not an insurmountable problem.

Eric Herman and I wrote a (very simple) ConsoleTester utility 
class to facilitate this sort of testing.  If anyone's interested,
I could upload the code to the files section of this group...?

Cheers,

Brett Neumeier
